IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: NW WORKS PROVIDES WORK AND SUPPORT SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS WITH SIGNIFICANT BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ENABLE ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO SELECT, SECURE, AND SUSTAIN VALUED EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING.
IRS990.Desc: INTEGRATED COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT: WORKFORCE DEVELOPERS PROVIDE CAREER FOCUSED SKILL BUILDING, SCREENING, PLACEMENT AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO ENSURE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES HAVE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR EMPLOYMENT WHILE REHABILITATION SPECIALISTS PROVIDE MEANINGFUL DAY ACTIVITIES FOR THOSE NOT ORIENTED TOWARDS EMPLOYMENT. INDIVIDUALS ARE EMPLOYED IN OR PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES IN SETTINGS THAT INCLUDE BOTH INDIVIDUALS WITH AND WITHOUT DISABILITIES. THESE ENVIRONMENTS HELP TO FOSTER GREATER INDEPENDENCE AND INCLUSION. WORKFORCE DEVELOPERS AND REHABILITATION SPECIALISTS PROVIDE ONGOING SUPPORTS TO ENSURE LONG-TERM SUPPORT WITH A FOCUS ON THE DESIRED OUTCOME OF THE INDIVIDUAL SEEKING EMPLOYMENT OR GREATER COMMUNITY INCLUSION. PERSONS SERVED: 136

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COMMERCIAL BUSINESSES: PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES ANNUALLY FOR MANY INDIVIDUALS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES ALONG WITH OTHER BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT. THIS EMPLOYMENT IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE TRADITIONALLY BEEN EXCLUDED FROM THE LABOR MARKET. COMMERCIAL BUSINESSES INCLUDE FIREFLY CAFE AND BAKERY, COMMERCIAL PACKAGING, AND WAREHOUSING AND DISTRIBUTION. WORKFORCE SUPPORT SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO EMPLOYEES WITH DISABILITIES AND OTHER BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT TO ENSURE ONGOING SUCCESS AND QUALITY DELIVERY OF GOODS AND SERVICES BASED ON CUSTOMER NEED. PERSONS SERVED: 139

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CONTRACTS: NW WORKS EMPLOYS PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES ON ABILITYONE CONTRACTS WHICH WERE SECURED FOR THE SOLE INTENT OF EXPANDING EMPLOYMENT FOR PEOPLE WITH SIGNIFICANT DISABILITIES. IN THESE SETTINGS, INDIVIDUALS EARN LIVING WAGES, HAVE HEALTH AND OTHER BENEFITS AND PAY TAXES TO BE FULLY CONTRIBUTING MEMBERS OF THEIR COMMUNITY. PERSONS SERVED: 17

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COST OF GOODS NETTED WITH REVENUE ON 990 872,966. MISCELLANEOUS EXPENSES NETTED WITH REVENUE ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS -1,336. ROUNDING 2.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: FAMILY MEMBER OF BRUCE DAWSON, DIRECTOR

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: REVENUE RECEIVED FROM RUBBERMAID. MR. JHAVERI IS VICE PRESIDENT OF MARKETING AT RUBBERMAID.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE IS A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN BOARD MEMBERS BRUCE DAWSON AND PAT DAWSON.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND THE CEO AND IS THEN PROVIDED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO A SUMMARY PRESENTATION TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT A MEETING WHICH PRECEDES ITS FILING. ANY SIGNIFICANT ITEMS NOTED DURING THE REVIEW PROCESS ARE DISCUSSED AT THIS MEETING, AND A SIGNATURE IS OBTAINED FROM THE BOARD PRESIDENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD REQUIRES ALL MEMBERS TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. ANY AREAS OF POTENTIAL CONFLICT ARE DISCUSSED AND REVIEWED FOR IMPACT ON CURRENT TRANSACTIONS AND ACTIVITIES OF THE ORGANIZATION WITH THE INTENTION OF AVOIDING ANY APPEARANCE OF IMPROPRIETY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EVERY THREE YEARS, THE ORGANIZATION OBTAINS A PUBLICATION BY ABBOT, LANGER & ASSOCIATES WHICH OFFERS COMPARABILITY DATA OF COMPENSATION FOR NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THIS PUBLICATION IS USED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS WHEN WAGE INCREASES ARE SUBMITTED WITH THE BUDGET PROPOSALS. THE PERTINENT CATEGORIES ARE REVIEWED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FINAL WAGES ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
